security_audit.summary: This is a pure documentation skill containing only markdown files with code examples for accessing the legitimate public RCSB PDB API. No executable scripts, no environment variable access, no sensitive data collection. All network calls documented are to official rcsb.org endpoints for public scientific data.

content.user_title: Access protein and nucleic acid 3D structures
content.value_statement: Finding 3D biological structures requires navigating multiple databases and file formats. This skill provides unified access to the RCSB PDB repository for searching, downloading, and analyzing over 200,000 experimentally determined and computed molecular structures.
actual_capabilities: Search protein and nucleic acid structures by text, sequence, or structural similarity
Download coordinate files in PDB, mmCIF, and BinaryCIF formats
Retrieve structural metadata, experimental methods, and quality metrics
Perform batch operations across multiple structures
Access GraphQL API for flexible data queries
limitations: Requires internet connection to access RCSB PDB API endpoints
Limited to publicly available structures in the RCSB PDB repository
Does not perform molecular visualization or analysis directly

use_cases.title: Find drug-target complexes
use_cases.description: Search for structures of target proteins bound to ligands for drug design and binding site analysis.

use_cases.title: Analyze sequence-structure relationships
use_cases.description: Find homologous structures and compare mutant variants for protein engineering projects.

use_cases.title: Download structures for study
use_cases.description: Retrieve and explore 3D molecular structures for educational purposes and visualization.

prompt_templates.title: Basic protein search
prompt_templates.prompt: Find PDB structures for {protein_name} from human organisms with resolution better than 2.5 angstroms.

prompt_templates.title: Sequence similarity
prompt_templates.prompt: Search for structures similar to this protein sequence: {sequence}. Use 90% identity cutoff.

prompt_templates.title: Download coordinates
prompt_templates.prompt: Download the mmCIF file for PDB ID {pdb_id} and show the experimental method and resolution.

prompt_templates.title: Batch retrieval
prompt_templates.query: Get title, resolution, and organism for all hemoglobin structures released in 2024.

best_practices: Install the official rcsb-api Python package for programmatic access to all features
Use appropriate file formats (mmCIF for modern structures, PDB for legacy compatibility)
Implement rate limiting with exponential backoff when making batch requests
anti_patterns: Making requests without checking for rate limit errors (HTTP 429)
Downloading individual files in a loop without batching or delays
Using deprecated rcsbsearchapi package instead of the current rcsb-api

faq.question: What is the difference between PDB and mmCIF formats?
faq.answer: PDB is the legacy text format with column positions. mmCIF is the modern standard using key-value pairs that supports larger structures.

faq.question: What does resolution mean for crystal structures?
faq.answer: Resolution in angstroms indicates structural detail level. Lower values mean higher detail (1.5-2.5 Ã… is high quality, above 3.0 Ã… is lower resolution).

faq.question: How do I use this with other tools?
faq.answer: Downloaded files work with PyMOL, Chimera, VMD, and Biopython for visualization and further computational analysis.

faq.question: Is the data safe to use?
faq.answer: RCSB PDB is a curated, authoritative repository maintained by Rutgers and UC San Diego. All deposited structures undergo validation.

faq.question: Why am I getting 429 errors?
faq.answer: You are making requests too fast. Add delays between requests and implement exponential backoff as shown in the documentation.

faq.question: How does this compare to AlphaFold?
faq.answer: RCSB PDB contains experimentally determined structures. For predicted structures, access AlphaFold DB separately through the RCSB interface.
